word: Samuel became a great man in the fullest sense, as God estimates character. . . . Young men should be trained to stand firm for the right amid the prevailing iniquity, to do all in their power to arrest the progress of vice, and to promote virtue, purity, and true manliness. The impressions made upon the mind and character in early life are deep and abiding.--Signs of the Times, Nov. 3, 1881.
